children.value: A black translucent prompt pops up in the middle of the page, which is used for message notifications, loading prompts, operation result prompts and other scenarios.
In order to facilitate the use of
, zebra-ui provides a series of auxiliary functions through which Toast components can be quickly evoked.
For example, if you use the
function, the corresponding light prompt will be rendered directly on the page after being called.
There is no need to import it after using the unplugin-auto-import plug-in. For details, see
method to display a text tooltip in the middle of the screen.
method to show the loading prompt, and the
method to display success prompts and the
The icon can be customized through the
option, which supports passing in the icon name or image link, which is equivalent to the
The loading icon type can be customized through the
Toast is rendered in the center of the screen by default, and the position of Toast display can be controlled through the
option can control the truncation method when the text in Toast is too long. The default value is
'This message will contain a incomprehensibilities long word.'
'This message will contain a incomprehensibilities long word.'
When the Toast method is executed, the corresponding Toast instance will be returned. By modifying the
attribute on the instance, the effect of dynamically updating the prompt can be achieved.
attribute, you can specify the callback function that
and other methods can be globally modified through the
If you need to embed components or other custom content within Toast, you can use the Toast component directly and use the message slot for customization.

props.code:
<z-toast use-component v-model:show="show" :duration="0">
   <template #message>
     <view class="toast-custom">
       <z-icon name="error" color="var(--z-orange)"></z-icon>
       <view> This is a piece of content. Are you sure you want to delete it? </view>
     </view>
     <view class="toast-button">
       <z-button type="primary" size="mini" @click="show = false"
         >Confirm</z-button
       >
       <z-button size="mini" @click="show = false">Cancel</z-button>
     </view>
   </template>
</z-toast>

children.value: > This is a piece of content. Are you sure you want to delete it? </

props.code:
import { ref } from 'vue';
const show = ref(false)

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
